Posts.Content: mca21 wrote: I just had a mammogram and ultrasound.  They said they saw what they called a cyst.  I had the same thing last year in the same breast and they aspirated.  They are going to aspirate this also. Should I be worried? Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2009 04:19PM mca21 wrote: I did have the mammogram and they also did an ultrasound.  The nurse said it was a cyst and that they will do the aspiration on the 11th.  I had the same thing done last year and it ended up only being a cyst also.  I am still worried though.  Should I be?  She just said it was a cyst.  She didn't specify complex or simple cyst.  What is the difference?  Can these be cancerous?
Posts.Title: mammogram mca21 mca21

Posts.Content: mca21 wrote: I am having a diagnostic mammogram tomorrow morning.  It has been a year since my last one.  I guess my question is why a diagnostic mammogram and not a screening one? Last year they found something on my mammo and gave me an ultrasound and they saw someting.  I had it aspirated and it ended up being a cyst. Two years ago I had a stereostatic biopsy because of what they saw and said it was solid.  That ended up being benign. I guess my question is why a diagnostic mammogram this time instead of a screening one.  Should I be worried. Log in to post a reply
